metadata.Title: CVE-2015-2735 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
nsZipArchive.cpp in Mozilla Firefox before 39.0, Firefox ESR 31.x before 31.8 and 38.x before 38.1, and Thunderbird before 38.1 accesses unintended memory locations, which allows remote attackers to have an unspecified impact via a crafted ZIP archive.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2735` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 39.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 39.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 39.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 39.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:31.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:31.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:31.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:31.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:31.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:31.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:31.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:31.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '39.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
thunderbird package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:31.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
